data.author: LTbeliever
data.content: Last year out on 28 Nov, so IMO in 3-4 weeks latest for Y/E 2025; we had Sales of 2.1mln for H1 2025, looking at maybe 5mln (min?) for FY, due to Adien and especially, TED (tnx to Unirail collaboration); if 5mln minimum, then Net Profits could reach +500k.  DYOR and GLA, not long to go.

data.author: LTbeliever
data.content: Https://www.gcre.wales/press-releases/designing-tomorrows-railway/ FWIW, TED was shortlisted for a grant - phase 2 - of 305k (half the current mkt cap?) in Jan 2024 (go to bottom of article/list); June 2024 AFS show a grant of 20k or so (phase 1), so these funds will show in June 2025 AFS; so TED will have already invested the 305k, plus its own money and finished the project sometime in early calendar 2025 (as also advised in the 2 min video, mentioning Feb 2025).  Unipart has already dedicated a special section on its website for this TED product, so one expects that it's already heavily promoting it globally. Obviously, many PIs got "burnt" last July but, at this SP level and the - IMO - expected turnaround in Revenues and CFlow, the upside far exceeds any downside risk. DYOR

data.author: LTbeliever
data.content: If u look at their AFS 2024, they mention TED collaboration therein, expansion plans of their rail ops (one of 4 "pillars") into USA, Australia, Asia etc.  They had over 1000 Sales' employees and over 200mln revenues (in Rail, i.e. about 20% of total). TED's Unipart-sourced revenues, were 50k in 2023, 1mln in 2024, how much would one reasonably expect for 2025 (to June 30th)? 2-3 million? DYOR

data.author: LTbeliever
data.content: Https://updates.unipart.com/construction-maintenance-renewal-machines https://www.unipartrail.com/blog/news/unipart-rail-launches-new-range-of-solutions-to-revolutionise-global-rail-renewal-operations/ Please have a look at the 2min video at the end of the page (1st link); project was to be launched early 2025, so quite likely that Revenues will be reflected in H1 2025 results (and outlook for FY2025); IMO, Unipart has a huge incentive to push TED's products all over the globe (areas not easily accessed by TED itself).  We will know in a month or two.

data.author: LTbeliever
data.content: Hi all, I'm new here; got myself a few shares last week after DMOR; seems PIP is turning the corner and the Results (out in Oct-Nov) will evidence this IMO. As some here say, the SP was crashed due to bankruptcy concerns but the Board owns 40+% of the stock, new Share Options were given to Senior Mgt and the distribution arrangement with Unipart Rail seems to be going from strength to strength; another factor not discussed here is the heavy investment in infrastructure spending (rail, transport, defence) in the EU thanks to Vladimir and the Donald. Europe is gearing up to be ready for quick, heavy use of rail for defence preparation, this is bound to increase demand for TED's products, plus the other subs. too. IMO Once oper. profits start shooting up (given the appx 50% GMargins), then the debt owed to the Chairman will also start dropping.  All said, I don't see why the Mkt cap cannot reach 5mln in 2-3 years.  GLA!

data.author: Laura2022
data.content: 80 leads generated since last Sept , so hopefully should hear some of these soon, now the seller is out earlier in 2025 it might be prudent for adding to my investment here Thomson Engineering Design Ltd ("TED") TED continues to see steady activity for request for quotes ("RFQs") in the UK for strategic equipment as contracts are slowly released from Network Rail. This steady activity may be attributed to the change in the UK government and its subsequent release of the UK autumn budget last year. Some of these RFQs have translated into orders for TED's innovative designs which we believe will push the rail industry into the 21st century both for Network Rail and for other UK contractors which can only be taken as a positive. We now hope to build on these UK orders going forward and as Network Rail builds up the momentum necessary to upgrade the UK's ageing rail infrastructure. The strategic relationship between Unipart Rail Limited ("Unipart") and TED continues to go from strength to strength. In September 2024, a suite of TED's equipment was exhibited at the world's largest bi-annual rail show, InnoTrans in Berlin, at which 80 positively qualified potential sales leads were generated. We believe that our presence at this show continues to establish TED's standing to the rest of the world.

DYOR and GLA, not long to go.

data.author: LTbeliever
data.content: Https://www.gcre.wales/press-releases/designing-tomorrows-railway/ FWIW, TED was shortlisted for a grant - phase 2 - of 305k (half the current mkt cap?) in Jan 2024 (go to bottom of article/list); June 2024 AFS show a grant of 20k or so (phase 1), so these funds will show in June 2025 AFS; so TED will have already invested the 305k, plus its own money and finished the project sometime in early calendar 2025 (as also advised in the 2 min video, mentioning Feb 2025).  Unipart has already dedicated a special section on its website for this TED product, so one expects that it's already heavily promoting it globally. Obviously, many PIs got "burnt" last July but, at this SP level and the - IMO - expected turnaround in Revenues and CFlow, the upside far exceeds any downside risk. DYOR

data.author: LTbeliever
data.content: If u look at their AFS 2024, they mention TED collaboration therein, expansion plans of their rail ops (one of 4 "pillars") into USA, Australia, Asia etc.  They had over 1000 Sales' employees and over 200mln revenues (in Rail, i.e. about 20% of total). TED's Unipart-sourced revenues, were 50k in 2023, 1mln in 2024, how much would one reasonably expect for 2025 (to June 30th)? 2-3 million? DYOR

data.author: LTbeliever
data.content: Https://updates.unipart.com/construction-maintenance-renewal-machines https://www.unipartrail.com/blog/news/unipart-rail-launches-new-range-of-solutions-to-revolutionise-global-rail-renewal-operations/ Please have a look at the 2min video at the end of the page (1st link); project was to be launched early 2025, so quite likely that Revenues will be reflected in H1 2025 results (and outlook for FY2025); IMO, Unipart has a huge incentive to push TED's products all over the globe (areas not easily accessed by TED itself).  We will know in a month or two.

data.author: LTbeliever
data.content: Hi all, I'm new here; got myself a few shares last week after DMOR; seems PIP is turning the corner and the Results (out in Oct-Nov) will evidence this IMO. As some here say, the SP was crashed due to bankruptcy concerns but the Board owns 40+% of the stock, new Share Options were given to Senior Mgt and the distribution arrangement with Unipart Rail seems to be going from strength to strength; another factor not discussed here is the heavy investment in infrastructure spending (rail, transport, defence) in the EU thanks to Vladimir and the Donald. Europe is gearing up to be ready for quick, heavy use of rail for defence preparation, this is bound to increase demand for TED's products, plus the other subs. too. IMO Once oper. profits start shooting up (given the appx 50% GMargins), then the debt owed to the Chairman will also start dropping.  All said, I don't see why the Mkt cap cannot reach 5mln in 2-3 years.  GLA!

data.author: Laura2022
data.content: 80 leads generated since last Sept , so hopefully should hear some of these soon, now the seller is out earlier in 2025 it might be prudent for adding to my investment here Thomson Engineering Design Ltd ("TED") TED continues to see steady activity for request for quotes ("RFQs") in the UK for strategic equipment as contracts are slowly released from Network Rail. This steady activity may be attributed to the change in the UK government and its subsequent release of the UK autumn budget last year. Some of these RFQs have translated into orders for TED's innovative designs which we believe will push the rail industry into the 21st century both for Network Rail and for other UK contractors which can only be taken as a positive. We now hope to build on these UK orders going forward and as Network Rail builds up the momentum necessary to upgrade the UK's ageing rail infrastructure. The strategic relationship between Unipart Rail Limited ("Unipart") and TED continues to go from strength to strength. In September 2024, a suite of TED's equipment was exhibited at the world's largest bi-annual rail show, InnoTrans in Berlin, at which 80 positively qualified potential sales leads were generated. We believe that our presence at this show continues to establish TED's standing to the rest of the world.

We will know in a month or two.

data.author: LTbeliever
data.content: Hi all, I'm new here; got myself a few shares last week after DMOR; seems PIP is turning the corner and the Results (out in Oct-Nov) will evidence this IMO. As some here say, the SP was crashed due to bankruptcy concerns but the Board owns 40+% of the stock, new Share Options were given to Senior Mgt and the distribution arrangement with Unipart Rail seems to be going from strength to strength; another factor not discussed here is the heavy investment in infrastructure spending (rail, transport, defence) in the EU thanks to Vladimir and the Donald. Europe is gearing up to be ready for quick, heavy use of rail for defence preparation, this is bound to increase demand for TED's products, plus the other subs. too. IMO Once oper. profits start shooting up (given the appx 50% GMargins), then the debt owed to the Chairman will also start dropping.  All said, I don't see why the Mkt cap cannot reach 5mln in 2-3 years.  GLA!

data.content: 80 leads generated since last Sept , so hopefully should hear some of these soon, now the seller is out earlier in 2025 it might be prudent for adding to my investment here Thomson Engineering Design Ltd ("TED") TED continues to see steady activity for request for quotes ("RFQs") in the UK for strategic equipment as contracts are slowly released from Network Rail. This steady activity may be attributed to the change in the UK government and its subsequent release of the UK autumn budget last year. Some of these RFQs have translated into orders for TED's innovative designs which we believe will push the rail industry into the 21st century both for Network Rail and for other UK contractors which can only be taken as a positive. We now hope to build on these UK orders going forward and as Network Rail builds up the momentum necessary to upgrade the UK's ageing rail infrastructure. The strategic relationship between Unipart Rail Limited ("Unipart") and TED continues to go from strength to strength. In September 2024, a suite of TED's equipment was exhibited at the world's largest bi-annual rail show, InnoTrans in Berlin, at which 80 positively qualified potential sales leads were generated. We believe that our presence at this show continues to establish TED's standing to the rest of the world.

company_30s.why_they_matter: Its parts are used in critical infrastructure, giving it a niche that could be profitable if it scales.
company_30s.current_state: The firm is struggling – it has been trading near zero for months and has no recent revenue or growth story.

Financial updates: The 2025 half‑year and full‑year reports were released, but they contain no new revenue figures or forward guidance.
Corporate changes: A non‑executive director passed away in September, and a sale of Utsi Electronics was announced in December, but no strategic impact is disclosed.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows zero interest – the search volume has been flat for months. Social media posts are non‑existent, confirming that the story has lost all oxygen and is not attracting any new investors.

near_term_catalysts: Next quarterly results (expected Q2 2026): The first revenue print would be a make‑or‑break moment for any bullish case.
Potential AGM (late Q3 2026): A vote on capital structure or a new strategic plan could either revive the story or confirm its demise.
expect_next.watch_for: Keep an eye on any director selling or a sudden placement of shares – both would signal management distress. The absence of any revenue surprise will keep the stock in a holding pattern.
expect_next.timing_regime: Exhausted – the APEX score is low, the chart shows no trend, and the story has lost all momentum. Entry timing is unlikely to be favourable without a clear catalyst.

buy_vs_sell.bull_case: The only way a bull case could materialise is if the company suddenly announces a new, high‑margin product line and delivers its first revenue. Even then, the price would need to recover from 0.00p, which is a steep climb.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: Given the 87% drop, flat Google Trends, zero social buzz, and no recent earnings or guidance, the risk that the story will never recover is high. The company’s lack of a clear value proposition and the absence of any forward‑looking data make a decline almost certain.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: Risk/reward is poor – the upside is capped at a few pence if any revenue emerges, while the downside is essentially a total loss of the current position.
